text.section: In accordance with the State budget, the Division may appoint officers and other employees as necessary to operate the Division and its units efficiently and effectively.

section.section: Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, all officers and other employees of the Division shall be appointed and removed in accordance with the provisions of the State Personnel and Pensions Article.
The warden of a correctional facility is the appointing officer for the officers and other employees of that facility.
The Commissioner is the appointing officer for the other officers and employees in the Division.

text.section: The Division may provide a dwelling for a warden.

A warden may not receive any compensation or perquisite other than:
the compensation and reimbursement provided under subsection (e) of this section; and
if provided under subsection (c) of this section, a dwelling.

section.section:
Officers and other employees are entitled to:
compensation as provided in the State budget; and
reimbursement for expenses in accordance with the Standard State Travel Regulations.
Officers and other employees working 40 hours or more per week in a correctional facility are entitled to one free meal per shift as provided in the State budget.
The Division may require an individual to pass a polygraph examination before being appointed to serve as a correctional officer in a correctional facility.
The Commissioner shall adopt regulations governing the administration of the polygraph examination authorized under paragraph (1) of this subsection.
